Posts.Content: I'm so sorry for your loss. She gave it a good fight. May she RIP. üôèüôè‚ù§
Posts.Title: In Memoriam, "New Challenges"

Posts.Content: I have been dealing with bone mets for almost 2 yrs. The onc started me on instance/faslodex, then AI, then Xeloda. They didn't work for me, but others do very well for years on them. Then I went to IV Taxol that worked for 7 mos. Dr is giving me a break for a month bc of side effects. I have been no progression or new tumors for over a year. When diagnosed I felt the same way you are feeling. It does get better. You will too, there is a period of depression. My Dr said the bones can hold more cancer than the organs, and tend to do better than when there's organ involvement. Trust in the Lord!
Posts.Title: Depression..

Posts.Content: I'm on zometa. The first treatment gave me body aches, nothing after that.
Posts.Title: How to cope ?

Posts.Content: Beth, I also have a steroid infusion before my chemo. For 2 or 3 nights after I take 1 mg of Lorazepam and it works pretty well. Might want to ask the Dr to change you from Xanax to lorazepam to see if it works better for you, or try a whole tablet instead of a half. Donna
Posts.Title: Dexamethasone and chemo

Posts.Content: I don't recall mouth sores on Xeloda. What was your previous med? I was on A/A and got sores. Only thing that works for me is IV chemo. I'm on doxil and I have a 1 inch sore on my inner cheek.
Posts.Title: I have 3 abscess in my mouth and Doctors want me to start xeloda?

Posts.Content: Angelical, unless you have severe pain in your pelvis, I would wait on the radiation. It weakens the bones. My dr is using it as a last resort for pain bc of this reason.
Posts.Title: Met Breast cancer to the bones

Posts.Content: That's wonderful? If you don't mind me asking, where are your mets and what are you taking for meds?
Posts.Title: Calling 5 plus years NED with mets

Posts.Content: Taxol was my first IV chemo. I was on it for 6 mos. I tolerated it well. S/E hit me about 3 days after treatment. Fatigue, acidy stomach, occ mouth sores and some neuropathy. If your active you probably will do ok with exercise. I'm moving on to liposomal Doxorubicin. Almost forgot....my hair started thinning so I shaved it off. It started growing back in! So don't be too quick to shave it off! Good luck, I'm sure you'll do fine.üíïüôè
Posts.Title: Life on Taxol

Posts.Content: Did he give you a shot of neupogen or neulasta? My neutrophils were 0 and my Dr admitted me to the hospital. Hope you do ok! üôèüôè
Posts.Title: WBC count at zero

Posts.Content: Denise9991, what type of breast cancer do you have, and what type of med are you on?
